instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00928: What is 820-00928? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with distorted speakers
threads.message: Hello guys , a client Brough in an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with distorted speakers , which we replaced with new ones but the distortion still remains , is there anything special on this models when replacing the speakers that I should do .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with distorted speakers
threads.message:
What about headphones sound?
Both left/right speakers sound bad?
Check <CHIP>U6360</CHIP> output level.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with distorted speakers
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with distorted speakers
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with distorted speakers
threads.message:
Very strange to have all power amplifiers failing.
So should be a problem with <CHIP>U6200</CHIP>...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with distorted speakers
threads.message: OK, thank you for your time

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with distorted speakers
threads.message: this can be closed , its resolved

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with distorted speakers
threads.message:
Let feedback of your solution please.
This can help other members in the future...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with distorted speakers
threads.message: The compartment for the speakers are designed to be AIR TIGHT , so when you install a new speaker you have to get try to get the same tightness, otherwise , the sound escape will create distortion. so I stuffed papers in the compartment to archive the closeness.  So the issue was not from the board, I realised this when I tried with a different top casing.
